alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Greene; Knox; Lawrence; Martin; Monroe; Sullivan (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 8:48AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Monroe, southeastern Sullivan, northeastern Knox, northern Martin, Greene, northwestern Lawrence and northeastern Daviess Counties through 915 AM EDT... At 847 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bloomfield, or 28 miles southwest of Bloomington, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Monroe, southeastern Sullivan, northeastern Knox, northern Martin, Greene, northwestern Lawrence and northeastern Daviess Counties, including the following locations... Newberry, Lyons, Indian Springs, Crane, Freelandville, Burns City, Sandborn, Odon, Dugger and Elnora. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until noon EDT for south central and southwestern Indiana.

area.areaDesc: Daviess; Greene; Knox; Lawrence; Martin; Monroe; Sullivan
